message: I tried to transition to Google Bookmarks when the bad news about Delicious being on Yahoo's chopping block got out but it never felt as convenient and usable as Delicious. So glad its going to stay (and evolve?) ! How do you like Delicious? What do you think where's it headed to in the next 6 months?
Bookmarking service Delicious found a new home finally! http://t.co/eDxAIQa
i glad it found a home, i never used delicious but since it was a big site and people want glad it is alive
remember that time everyone paid $9.31 for a delicious clone?
This is great news! I love delicious and like @abhinavsood did, I tried to move to another similar service but there was nothing like delicious.
@verbal I only paid about $5.36. That's exponentially better than $9.31.
@verbal yeah, that was ridiculous! I imported them into my browsers instead. Search-as-you-type +10 Firefox slowing down -1

It's good that Delicious finally found a new home, especially since I've been a user since it was del.icio.us. I looked for a replacement when it was initially thought Yahoo was going to close the service, but I never was able to find anything that fit as well.
You can add me to your delicious network : AbhinavSood I mostly bookmark stuff related to web design, PHP, Python, WordPress, web2py, startups, productivity etc.
great, now how do I move all my *new* bookmarks from pinboard to delicious.
http://www.centernetworks.com/youtube-founders-acquire-delicious What? No, I don't agree. Do you?

@abhinavsood  i don't get this guy... why does he care enough to write about it if he doesn't care about his delicious bookmarks? "How many users just don’t want to spend the time to do the move?" -- um, it took like, 5 seconds.  although, i did have some trial and error involved with logging in.
I agree. the only -1 I faced was not being able to chose a password which they told me resembled my user name too much, but no it didn't! Other than that, the setup was a snap!
When I read about this I deleted all my delicious bookmarks .. Hurley and Co. can't have 'em!!
Are most people happy with Pinboard now? I sure am.

@katylava It was an incredibly easy process to migrate to the new service, but I guess you don't really know that until you actually do it. Nothing in the email from Yahoo says about how involved the process may or may not be.
